titles.title: To request a conference with the Senate on an amendment of the House to the bill (S. 636) to amend the Public Health Service Act to permit individuals to have freedom of access to certain medical clinics and facilities, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-427, by Ms. Slaughter.

Rule provides for consideration of S. 636. Upon the adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to take from the Speaker's table the bill S. 636 and to consider the bill in the House. All points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived. It shall be in order to move to strike all after the enacting clause of the Senate bill and to insert in lieu thereof the provisions of H.R. 796 as passed by the House. If the motion is agreed to and S. 636, as amended, is passed by the House, it shall be in order to move that the House insist on its amendments to S. 636 and request a conference with the Senate thereon.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 137.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 168 (Roll no. 66).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 244 - 171 (Roll no. 67).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/2/1994--Introduced. Provides for taking from the Speaker's table S. 636 (amending the Public Health Service Act to permit individuals to have freedom of access to certain medical clinics and facilities), substituting the language of H.R. 796 as passed by the House, passing S. 636, and requesting a conference.
